Package http.server

Class ServerThread

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
http.server.ServerThread
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class ServerThread
extends java.lang.Thread
A thread of the server that is created when a new connection is established and that handles the associated request

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

    java.lang.Thread.State, java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

    The socket to which this ServerThread is connected
    (package private) Request req
    The request associated

    ServerThread​(java.net.Socket remote)

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.lang.String checkURIAbsent​(Request req, java.io.PrintWriter out)
    Method used to check if the URI is absent (is equal to '/'): if absent, sends 404 code and return an empty string, otherwise, returns the URI of the request
    void handleDELETE​(Request req, java.io.PrintWriter out)
    Method used to handle DELETE Requests: Deletes the file specified in the URI If URI is equal to '/' or if the file is not found, sends 404 Code
    void handleGET​(Request req, java.io.OutputStream out)
    Method used to handle GET Requests: Sends the requested file if there are no parameters in the URI, processes the action to do otherwise.
    void handleHEAD​(Request req, java.io.PrintWriter out)
    Method used to handle HEAD Requests: Sends the head of the requested file in the URI.
    void handlePOST​(Request req, java.io.PrintWriter out)
    Method used to handle POST Requests: Writes the content of the body of the Request at the end of the file specified in the URI : if URI is absent (is equal to '/'), sends 404 Code
    void handlePUT​(Request req, java.io.PrintWriter out)
    Method used to handle POST Requests: Writes the content of the body of the Request in the file specified in the URI deleting the previous content: if URI is absent (is equal to '/'), sends 404 Code
    void handleUnrecognized​(java.io.PrintWriter out)
    Method called when the method of the request is not supported by our server
    void run()
    Method responsible for handling the request in this thread

    • handleUnrecognized

      public void handleUnrecognized​(java.io.PrintWriter out)
      Method called when the method of the request is not supported by our server
      Parameters:
      out - Output stream to which to write

    • handleGET

      public void handleGET​(Request req, java.io.OutputStream out)
      Method used to handle GET Requests: Sends the requested file if there are no parameters in the URI, processes the action to do otherwise. If URI is equal to '/', sends the file page1.html by default
      Parameters:
      req - the request to handle
      out - Output stream to which to write

    • handlePOST

      public void handlePOST​(Request req, java.io.PrintWriter out)
      Method used to handle POST Requests: Writes the content of the body of the Request at the end of the file specified in the URI : if URI is absent (is equal to '/'), sends 404 Code
      Parameters:
      req - the request to handle
      out - Output stream to which to write

    • handleHEAD

      public void handleHEAD​(Request req, java.io.PrintWriter out)
      Method used to handle HEAD Requests: Sends the head of the requested file in the URI. If URI is equal to '/', sends the file page1.html by default
      Parameters:
      req - the request to handle
      out - Output stream to which to write

    • handleDELETE

      public void handleDELETE​(Request req, java.io.PrintWriter out)
      Method used to handle DELETE Requests: Deletes the file specified in the URI If URI is equal to '/' or if the file is not found, sends 404 Code
      Parameters:
      req - the request to handle
      out - Output stream to which to write

    • handlePUT

      public void handlePUT​(Request req, java.io.PrintWriter out)
      Method used to handle POST Requests: Writes the content of the body of the Request in the file specified in the URI deleting the previous content: if URI is absent (is equal to '/'), sends 404 Code
      Parameters:
      req - the request to handle
      out - Output stream to which to write

    • checkURIAbsent

      public java.lang.String checkURIAbsent​(Request req, java.io.PrintWriter out)
      Method used to check if the URI is absent (is equal to '/'): if absent, sends 404 code and return an empty string, otherwise, returns the URI of the request
      Parameters:
      req - the request to handle
      out - Output stream to which to write
      Returns:
      name of page/file requested or an empty string
